Aniket's Notes

Bias: Training Error

Bias is difference between our actual and predicted values. When bias is too high, assumptions made by our model are too basic, model couldn't capture the important features of our data. Basically this is Underfitting

Variance: Testing Error

Variance is the very opposite of Bias. During training, it allows our model to 'see the data a certain number of times to find patterns in it. If it does not work on the data for long enough, it will not find patterns and bias occurs. We can define variance as the model's sensitivity to fluctuations in the data. Our model may learn from noise. This will cause our model to consider trivial features as important

The KNN Algorithm

  1. Load the data
  2. Initialize k to your chosen number of neighbors
  3. for each example in data
    1. Calculate distance between query example and current example
    2. Add the distance and index of the example to an ordered collection
  4. Sort the ordered collection of distances and indices in ascending order by distances
  5. Pick first k entries
  6. Get the labels of selected k entries
  7. If regression, return the mean of k labels
  8. If classification, return the mode of k labels
